Dependency.name: Devices with OS not updated for at least 30 days (IT Governance)
Devices not rebooted for at least 30 days (IT Governance)
Devices with Windows license not activated (IT Governance)
Devices with system disk free space issues
Devices with long boot or logon duration
Executables with many application not responding events
Windows devices with OS not updated for at least 30 days
Devices performing port or network scans
Devices with high external upload traffic

dashboard.description: # Cost control This dashboard shows underused assets that could be saved: - devices running less than 30 minutes in a day - printers used less than 5 times in a day
dashboard.name: Cost control

dashboard.description:
# Overall This dashboard gives you an overview of different issues that may affect your IT governance. They are broken down into three main sections: * **Risk**: these metrics highlight the devices that don’t comply with common IT policies as well as the one presenting some security threats. * **End-user experience**: these metrics show problems encountered by users while using the IT infrastructure, being devices or applications. * **Cost control**: these metrics give hints about areas where money could be saved
::: configuration You have to configure the [Compliance](nxt://Edit-NxCategory?Encoding=Url&Name=Compliance&Type=binary) category on binaries to match your corporate policies in terms of browsers. :::
dashboard.name: Overall

metric.label: OS not updated for at least 30 days
Not rebooted for at least 30 days

dashboard.description:
# Risks: non-compliant devices This dashboard shows devices that don’t comply with common IT policies. To be considered compliant: - The antivirus and antispyware must be up-to-date and running - The firewall must be switched on - Only the corporate browser should have been used - The device should have been updated and rebooted in the last month - The Windows license must be activated
::: configuration You have to configure the [Compliance](nxt://Edit-NxCategory?Encoding=Url&Name=Compliance&Type=binary) category on binaries to match your corporate policies in terms of browsers. :::
dashboard.name: Risk: non-compliant devices

metric.label: Not updated for at least 30 days
Not rebooted for at least 30 days

dashboard.description: # Risks: security threats This dashboard shows devices that present security threats to your business. These are devices that are: - Running binaries flagged as “high threat” - Accessing web domains with a reputation of “high risk” - Performing port or network scans - Uploading large amounts of data (> 1GB) to an external server
dashboard.name: Risk: security threats

titleConfig.title: Devices doing port or network scans

metric.label: Devices doing port or network scans

dashboard.description: # UX: applications issues This dashboard shows executables that present issues in terms of user experience. These are executables that are: - crashing more than 5 times a day - freezing more than 5 times a day - experiencing many failed connections - in high thread CPU usage during more than 20% of their execution duration
dashboard.name: UX: application issues

dashboard.description: # UX: device issues This dashboard shows devices that present issues in terms of user experience. These are devices that are: - using a lot of memory more than 30% of the time - experiencing bluescreens - using a lot of CPU more than 10% of the time - having less than 3 GB of free space on their system hard drive - experiencing many failed connections - booting in more than 1 minute or logging the user on in more than 2 minutes - having more than 2 application crashes in a day
dashboard.name: UX: device issues

titleConfig.title: Devices with disk free space issues
